Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can include different plants and animals in the habitat, such as drawing seaweed and other fish.
The student can draw and label the basic needs of the fish, such as water and oxygen.
The student can illustrate a basic interaction between the fish and its environment, like the fish swimming among plants.
The student can show how the habitat provides resources, drawing and labeling water and suggesting food sources.
The student can depict the fish as part of a system, possibly adding another organism like a smaller fish or seaweed.
CANNOT: The student might not fully detail more complex relationships, such as predator-prey dynamics (student can show other organisms but may not depict specific interactions).
The student may occasionally forget or mislabel minor elements, such as misplacing a label like 'oxygen' on a cloud rather than bubbles in the water (student labels some needs inconsistently).
